creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: castle L of C in background, with two men on white horses nearby; wavelike motif in foreground at bottom with a mermaid emerging at R; two cherubs wrestle near sun and ships at URC; flame like motif with armor helmets at ULC with griffin
inscription:
Signature, Date, Inscription, Stamp, Watermark

-- inscribed in cartouche in plate at left: [ni Soit / AQ ED]
-- inscribed in graphite on recto, lower left of sheet: [indeciperable marks]
-- in graphite on verso: 2nd etat URC | \"a\" (circled) | [indeciperable letters] 22 | APG 7231
markings: artist\'s red owl stamp on recto, in center below image, Lugt 977; unidentified watermark, partial, with lettering
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold May 13, 1986, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed and dated in plate, lower left: [Fx BUHOT del sc / 1878]
title: "The Devil in Love," by Cazotte, Second Vignette
